result.markdown:
---
title: "Hands-on Ex 1"
author: "Liang Xiuhao Rydia"
date: "April 13, 2024"
date-modified: "last-modified"
execute:
  eval: true
  echo: true
  warning: false
  freeze: true
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# load tidyverse from pacman
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

# load exam data using readr, part of tidyverse package
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

# R base Histogram
hist(exam_data$MATHS)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# ggplot histogram
ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="black", 
                 fill="grey") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# If the dataset is not already a data.frame, it will be converted to one by fortify().
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Bar Chart
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Dotplot / scale_y_continuous to turn off y-axis
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,         
               dotsize = 0.5) +      
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,           
                     breaks = NULL)  
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-5.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Histogram, changing geom() 
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 color="black",
                 fill='light blue') 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-6.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Histogram, changing aes()
# This approach can be used to colour, fill and alpha of the geometric.
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "grey30") 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-7.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Kernel Density Estimate (KDE), changing aes()
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS,
           color = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()   
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-8.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Boxplot, notches to determine if median differs
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS,       
           x= GENDER)) +    
  geom_boxplot(notch=T) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-9.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Violin plot - comparing multiple data distributions
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-10.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# geom_point - scatterplot
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()            
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-11.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Combining geom objects
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +                    
  geom_point(position="jitter", 
             size = 0.5)        
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-12.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Using stat_summary(), use fun="mean", fun.y has deprecated
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",       
               fun="mean",         
               colour ="red",        
               size=4)  
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-13.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Using stat in geom_point(), use fun instead of fun.y
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",        
             fun="mean",           
             colour ="red",          
             size=4) 
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-14.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# geom_smooth() for best fit curve on scatterplot, default method = loess
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(linewidth=0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](hands-on-ex1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-15.png){width=672}
:::
:::
